task.title: Create a map in Oxygen
task.shortdesc: You rarely make maps, but they are how you get started.

context.p: Akin to learning how to cast on in knitting, you spend much more time working in maps than making new maps.
I've set up bookmaps for you to use, but if you want to experiment on your own, have fun.

step.cmd: Use your favorite method to make a new file in Oxygen.
In the Filter field, enter map.
step.stepresult: This filters the list of available templates to just the map style templates.

step.cmd: Select Framework templates DITA Maps Map [DITA/Maps] .
Confirm the path and file name.
step.info: The file name is auto-generated based on the title for the map.
step.stepxmp: For example, the title My first map becomes my_first_map.ditamap.

taskbody.result: Oxygen creates your new map file.
taskbody.postreq: Oxygen prompts whether you want to open the map in the editor or the DITA Maps Manager. I recommend you open the map in the DITA Maps Manager.
